intro: Dortmanna coronopifolia var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved Dortmanna, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its glabrous (smooth) leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It has a compact, herbaceous growth habit and is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
